response.answer_text: I think, based on what I have read about the constitutional deliberations, as well as the shortcomings of the Articles of Confederation (you really can’t understand the Constitution without first understanding why it was written), I suggest they did not want two things: They absolutely did not want anything resembling a Monarchy. They wanted a representative government, where the needs of ‘the people’ were seen as dominant.On the other hand, they absolutely did not want anything resembling majority rule. They wanted to craft a system that gave a real voice to the minority to put at least some brakes on the majority.So, to paraphrase Ben Franklin, they created a Republic—if we can keep it.

the biggest thing they didnt want is something ignorant politicians and the media claim we have on a daily basis. What is it you ask? DEMOCRACY Our founding fathers knew that a Democracy was an assault on the rights of an individual. Thats why we have a constitution.
